YAHOO.widget.DataSource.name: YAHOO.widget.DataSource

constructors.description:
The DataSource classes manages sending a request and returning response from a live
database. Supported data include local JavaScript arrays and objects and databases
accessible via XHR connections. Supported response formats include JavaScript arrays,
JSON, XML, and flat-file textual data.

dataErrorEvent.description: Fired when an error is encountered with the live data source.

getCachedResultsEvent.description: Fired when data is retrieved from the local cache.

cacheQueryEvent.description: Fired when a query is made to the local cache.

queryEvent.description: Fired when a query is made to the live data source.

cacheFlushEvent.description: Fired when the local cache is flushed.

getResultsEvent.description: Fired when data is retrieved from the live data source.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

getResults.description:
Retrieves query results, first checking the local cache, then making the
query request to the live data source as defined by the function doQuery.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function implemented by oParent to which to return results.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

doQuery.description:
Abstract method implemented by subclasses to make a query to the live data
source. Must call the callback function with the response returned from the
query. Populates cache (if enabled).

return.description: Unique name of the DataSource instance

toString.description: Public accessor to the unique name of the DataSource instance.

return.description: aResults  Array of results from local cache if found, otherwise null.

_doQueryCache.description:
Queries the local cache for results. If query has been cached, the callback
function is called with the results, and the cached is refreshed so that it
is now the newest element.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

params.name: oResult
params.description: Data result object, including array of results.

_addCacheElem.description:
Adds a result object to the local cache, evicting the oldest element if the 
cache is full. Newer items will have higher indexes, the oldest item will have
index of 0.

_nIndex.description: Internal class variable to index multiple DataSource instances.

maxCacheEntries.description:
Max size of the local cache.  Set to 0 to turn off caching.  Caching is
useful to reduce the number of server connections.  Recommended only for data
sources that return comprehensive results for queries or when stale data is
not an issue.

queryMatchSubset.description:
Enables query subset matching. If caching is on and queryMatchSubset is
true, substrings of queries will return matching cached results. For
instance, if the first query is for "abc" susequent queries that start with
"abc", like "abcd", will be queried against the cache, and not the live data
source. Recommended only for DataSources that return comprehensive results
for queries with very few characters.

_aCache.description: Local cache of data result objects indexed chronologically.

ERROR_DATANULL.description: Error message for null data responses.

queryMatchCase.description:
Enables query case-sensitivity matching. If caching is on and
queryMatchCase is true, queries will only return results for case-sensitive
matches.

queryMatchContains.description:
Use this to equate cache matching with the type of matching done by your live
data source. If caching is on and queryMatchContains is true, the cache
returns results that "contain" the query string. By default,
queryMatchContains is set to false, meaning the cache only returns results
that "start with" the query string.

ERROR_DATAPARSE.description: Error message for data responses with parsing errors.

YAHOO.widget.DataSource.description:
The DataSource classes manages sending a request and returning response from a live
database. Supported data include local JavaScript arrays and objects and databases
accessible via XHR connections. Supported response formats include JavaScript arrays,
JSON, XML, and flat-file textual data.

YAHOO.widget.DS_JSFunction.name: YAHOO.widget.DS_JSFunction

params.name: oFunction
params.description: In-memory Javascript function that returns query results as an array of objects.

constructors.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using a native Javascript function as
its live data source.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

doQuery.description:
Queries the live data source defined by function for results. Results are
passed back to a callback function.

dataFunction.description: In-memory Javascript function that returns query results.

YAHOO.widget.DS_JSFunction.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using a native Javascript function as
its live data source.

YAHOO.widget.AutoComplete.name: YAHOO.widget.AutoComplete

params.name: elInput
params.description: DOM element reference or string ID of an input field

params.name: elContainer
params.description: DOM element reference or string ID of an existing DIV

constructors.description:
The AutoComplete class provides the customizable functionality of a plug-and-play DHTML auto completion widget. Some key features:
  • Navigate with up/down arrow keys and/or mouse to pick a selection
  • The drop down container can "roll down" or "fly out" via configurable animation
  • UI look-and-feel customizable through CSS, including container attributes, borders, position, fonts, etc

dataErrorEvent.description:
Fired when the AutoComplete instance does not receive query results from the
DataSource due to an error.

dataReturnEvent.description:
Fired when the AutoComplete instance receives query results from the data
source.

containerExpandEvent.description: Fired when the results container is expanded.

itemArrowToEvent.description: Fired when result item has been arrowed to.

itemArrowFromEvent.description: Fired when result item has been arrowed away from.

typeAheadEvent.description:
Fired when the input field has been prefilled by the type-ahead
feature.

textboxFocusEvent.description: Fired when the input field receives focus.

params.name: oData
params.description:
The data returned for the item, either as an object,
or mapped from the schema into an array.

itemSelectEvent.description: Fired when an item is selected via mouse click, ENTER key, or TAB key.

dataRequestEvent.description: Fired when the AutoComplete instance makes a query to the DataSource.

itemMouseOverEvent.description: Fired when result item has been moused over.

_sLastTextboxValue.description:
Internal tracker to last known textbox value, used to determine whether or not
to trigger a query via interval for certain IME users.

unmatchedItemSelectEvent.description:
Fired when a user selection does not match any of the displayed result items.
Note that this event may not behave as expected when delimiter characters
have been defined.

selectionEnforceEvent.description:
Fired if forceSelection is enabled and the user's input has been cleared
because it did not match one of the returned query results.

textboxKeyEvent.description: Fired when the input field receives key input.

textboxBlurEvent.description: Fired when the input field loses focus.

containerCollapseEvent.description: Fired when the results container is collapsed.

itemMouseOutEvent.description: Fired when result item has been moused out.

params.name: oTextbox
params.description: Text input box element in which to select text.

params.name: nStart
params.description: Starting index of text string to select.

_selectText.description: Selects text in the input field.

params.name: bShow
params.description: True if container is expanded, false if collapsed

_toggleContainerHelpers.description: Syncs results container with its helpers.

_initContainer.description: Initializes the results container once at object creation

params.name: oItem
params.description: The <li> element item whose data populates the input field.

_typeAhead.description:
Updates in the text input box with the first query result as the user types,
selecting the substring that the user has not typed.

return.description: Array of <li> elements within the results container.

getListItems.description:
Public accessor to the internal array of DOM <li> elements that
display query results within the results container.

params.name: oNewItem
params.description: The <li> element item to receive highlight behavior.

params.name: sType
params.description: Type "mouseover" will toggle highlight on, and "mouseout" will toggle highlight off.

_toggleHighlight.description:
Toggles the highlight on or off for an item in the container, and also cleans
up highlighting of any previous item.

_onTextboxFocus.description: Handles text input box receiving focus.

_initList.description:
Clears out contents of container body and creates up to
YAHOO.widget.AutoComplete#maxResultsDisplayed <li> elements in an
<ul> element.

return.description: True if key should be ignored, false otherwise.

_isIgnoreKey.description:
Whether or not key is functional or should be ignored. Note that the right
arrow key is NOT an ignored key since it triggers queries for certain intl
charsets.

params.name: oNewItem
params.description: The <li> element item to receive highlight behavior.

params.name: sType
params.description: Type "mouseover" will toggle highlight on, and "mouseout" will toggle highlight off.

_togglePrehighlight.description: Toggles the pre-highlight on or off for an item in the container.

params.name: sHeader
params.description: HTML markup for results container body.

setBody.description:
Sets HTML markup for the results container body. This markup will be
inserted within a <div> tag with a class of "ac_bd".

params.name: oItem
params.description: The <li> element item with which to update the value.

_updateValue.description:
Updates the text input box value with selected query result. If a delimiter
has been defined, then the value gets appended with the delimiter.

params.name: aResults
params.description: An array of query result objects from the DataSource.

_populateList.description:
Populates the array of <li> elements in the container with query
results. This method is passed to YAHOO.widget.DataSource#getResults as a
callback function so results from the DataSource instance are returned to the
AutoComplete instance.

return.description: Return true to continue expanding container, false to cancel the expand.

doBeforeExpandContainer.description:
Overridable method called before container expands allows implementers to access data
and DOM elements.

_moveSelection.description:
Triggered by up and down arrow keys, changes the current highlighted
<li> element item. Scrolls container if necessary.

_initContainerHelpers.description:
Initializes the results container helpers if they are enabled and do
not exist

return.description: Unique name of the AutoComplete instance.

toString.description: Public accessor to the unique name of the AutoComplete instance.

_onItemMouseout.description: Handles <li> element mouseout events in the container.

return.description: Object or array of result data or null

getListItemData.description:
Public accessor to the data held in an <li> element of the
results container.

_sendQuery.description: Makes query request to the DataSource.

params.name: sFooter
params.description: HTML markup for results container footer.

setFooter.description:
Sets HTML markup for the results container footer. This markup will be
inserted within a <div> tag with a class of "ac_ft".

_selectItem.description: Selects a result item from the container

_enableIntervalDetection.description:
Enables query triggers based on text input detection by intervals (rather
than by key events).

sendQuery.description: Makes query request to the DataSource.

params.name: bShow
params.description: True if container should be expanded, false if container should be collapsed

_toggleContainer.description: Animates expansion or collapse of the container.

_clearSelection.description:
When forceSelection is true and the user attempts
leave the text input box without selecting an item from the query results,
the user selection is cleared.

__initProps.description: Updates and validates latest public config properties.

return.description: Returns true if container is in an expanded state, false otherwise.

isContainerOpen.description: Returns true if container is in an expanded state, false otherwise.

_cancelIntervalDetection.description: Cancels text input detection by intervals.

_initListItem.description: Initializes each <li> element in the container list.

return.description: HTML markup of formatted result data.

params.name: oResultItem
params.description: Result item representing one query result. Data is held in an array.

formatResult.description:
Overridable method that converts a result item object into HTML markup
for display. Return data values are accessible via the oResultItem object,
and the key return value will always be oResultItem[0]. Markup will be
displayed within <li> element tags in the container.

return.description: True if user-input text matches a result, false otherwise.

_textMatchesOption.description:
Whether or not user-typed value in the text input box matches any of the
query results.

_onItemMouseover.description: Handles <li> element mouseover events in the container.

_onTextboxKeyDown.description: Handles textbox keydown events of functional keys, mainly for UI behavior.

_onItemMouseclick.description: Handles <li> element click events in the container.

_onTextboxBlur.description: Handles text input box losing focus.

_onTextboxKeyUp.description: Handles textbox keyup events that trigger queries.

_onIMEDetected.description: Enables interval detection for  Korean IME support.

_jumpSelection.description:
For values updated by type-ahead, the right arrow key jumps to the end
of the textbox, otherwise the container is closed.

params.name: sHeader
params.description: HTML markup for results container header.

setHeader.description:
Sets HTML markup for the results container header. This markup will be
inserted within a <div> tag with a class of "ac_hd".

forceSelection.description:
Whether or not to force the user's selection to match one of the query
results. Enabling this feature essentially transforms the input field into a
<select> field. This feature is not recommended with delimiter character(s)
defined.

animHoriz.description:
Whether or not to animate the expansion/collapse of the results container in the
horizontal direction.

useShadow.description: Whether or not the results container should have a shadow.

useIFrame.description:
Whether or not to use an iFrame to layer over Windows form elements in
IE. Set to true only when the results container will be on top of a
<select> field in IE and thus exposed to the IE z-index bug (i.e.,
5.5 < IE < 7).

_iFrameSrc.description:
Src to iFrame used when useIFrame = true. Supports implementations over SSL
as well.

_queryInterval.description:
For users typing via certain IMEs, queries must be triggered by intervals,
since key events yet supported across all browsers for all IMEs.

_maxResultsDisplayed.description: Internal count of <li> elements displayed and hidden in results container.

_aListItems.description:
Array of <li> elements references that contain query results within the
results container.

_nKeyCode.description: Key code of the last key pressed in textbox.

typeAhead.description:
Whether or not the input field should be automatically updated
with the first query result as the user types, auto-selecting the substring
that the user has not typed.

_nDisplayedItems.description: Number of <li> elements currently displayed in results container.

_bOverContainer.description:
Whether or not the mouse is currently over the results
container. This is necessary in order to prevent clicks on container items
from being text input field blur events.

delimChar.description:
Query delimiter. A single character separator for multiple delimited
selections. Multiple delimiter characteres may be defined as an array of
strings. A null value or empty string indicates that query results cannot
be delimited. This feature is not recommended if you need forceSelection to
be true.

alwaysShowContainer.description:
Whether or not the results container should always be displayed.
Enabling this feature displays the container when the widget is instantiated
and prevents the toggling of the container to a collapsed state.

minQueryLength.description:
Number of characters that must be entered before querying for results. A negative value
effectively turns off the widget. A value of 0 allows queries of null or empty string
values.

prehighlightClassName.description: Class name of a pre-highlighted item within results container.

highlighClassName.description: Class name of a highlighted item within results container.

_sSavedQuery.description: Past queries this session (for saving delimited queries).

_bItemSelected.description:
Whether or not an item has been selected since the container was populated
with results. Reset to false by _populateList, and set to true when item is
selected.

dataSource.description:
The DataSource object that encapsulates the data used for auto completion.
This object should be an inherited object from YAHOO.widget.DataSource.

autoHighlight.description:
Whether or not the first item in results container should be automatically highlighted
on expand.

allowBrowserAutocomplete.description:
Whether or not to allow browsers to cache user-typed input in the input
field. Disabling this feature will prevent the widget from setting the
autocomplete="off" on the input field. When autocomplete="off"
and users click the back button after form submission, user-typed input can
be prefilled by the browser from its cache. This caching of user input may
not be desired for sensitive data, such as credit card numbers, in which
case, implementers should consider setting allowBrowserAutocomplete to false.

animVert.description:
Whether or not to animate the expansion/collapse of the results container in the
vertical direction.

_nIndex.description: Internal class variable to index multiple AutoComplete instances.

_bContainerOpen.description: Whether or not the results container is currently open.

animSpeed.description: Speed of container expand/collapse animation, in seconds..

_oCurItem.description: Pointer to the currently highlighted <li> element in the container.

maxResultsDisplayed.description: Maximum number of results to display in results container.

_bFocused.description:
Whether or not the input field is currently in focus. If query results come back
but the user has already moved on, do not proceed with auto complete behavior.

queryDelay.description:
Number of seconds to delay before submitting a query request.  If a query
request is received before a previous one has completed its delay, the
previous request is cancelled and the new request is set to the delay.

YAHOO.widget.AutoComplete.description:
The AutoComplete class provides the customizable functionality of a plug-and-play DHTML auto completion widget. Some key features:
  • Navigate with up/down arrow keys and/or mouse to pick a selection
  • The drop down container can "roll down" or "fly out" via configurable animation
  • UI look-and-feel customizable through CSS, including container attributes, borders, position, fonts, etc

YAHOO.widget.DS_JSArray.name: YAHOO.widget.DS_JSArray

params.name: aData
params.description: In-memory Javascript array of simple string data.

constructors.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using a native Javascript array as
its live data source.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

doQuery.description:
Queries the live data source defined by data for results. Results are passed
back to a callback function.

YAHOO.widget.DS_JSArray.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using a native Javascript array as
its live data source.

YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.name: YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR

params.name: sScriptURI
params.description:
Absolute or relative URI to script that returns query
results as JSON, XML, or delimited flat-file data.

constructors.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using XML HTTP requests that return
query results.

params.name: oResponse
params.description: The raw response data to parse.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

parseResponse.description:
Parses raw response data into an array of result objects. The result data key
is always stashed in the [0] element of each result object.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

doQuery.description:
Queries the live data source defined by scriptURI for results. Results are
passed back to a callback function.

responseType.description:
XHR response data type. Other types that may be defined are YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.TYPE_XML
and YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.TYPE_FLAT.

scriptQueryAppend.description:
String of key/value pairs to append to requests made to scriptURI. Define
this string when you want to send additional query parameters to your script.
When defined, queries will be sent to
<scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput&<scriptQueryAppend>

responseStripAfter.description:
String after which to strip results. If the results from the XHR are sent
back as HTML, the gzip HTML comment appears at the end of the data and should
be ignored.

scriptURI.description:
Absolute or relative URI to script that returns query results. For instance,
queries will be sent to <scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput

connTimeout.description:
Number of milliseconds the XHR connection will wait for a server response. A
a value of zero indicates the XHR connection will wait forever. Any value
greater than zero will use the Connection utility's Auto-Abort feature.

scriptQueryParam.description:
Query string parameter name sent to scriptURI. For instance, queries will be
sent to <scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput

connMgr.description:
Alias to YUI Connection Manager. Allows implementers to specify their own
subclasses of the YUI Connection Manager utility.

YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using XML HTTP requests that return
query results.

autocomplete.name: autocomplete
autocomplete.title: AutoComplete Widget
autocomplete.description:
The AutoComplete control provides the front-end logic for text-entry suggestion and
completion functionality.
